pullRequest.body:
This file defines the category of pointed objects of a concrete category. After this we will have the categories of pointed groups, pointed abelian groups, pointed groupoids, etc. 

To define `Pointed.functor`, we need to add the following "pullback" construction to the category of elements. 
```
@[simps obj map]
def pullback (F : D ⥤ Type w) (G : C ⥤ D) :
    (G ⋙ F).Elements ⥤ F.Elements where
  obj X := ⟨G.obj X.1, X.2⟩
  map {X Y} f := ⟨G.map f.1, f.2⟩
```
This is called pullback since the display map of `G ⋙ F` (i.e. `π (G ⋙ F)`) is a pullback of the display map of `F`. 

---

### PR summary [1139ef2782](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15055/commits/1139ef2782492a1c9a9cf94e210cca8ffbae85b0)

#### Import changes for modified files

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.ConcreteCategory.Pointed`|403|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Hom`
`+ Hom.ext`
`+ Pointed`
`+ category`
`+ comp_obj`
`+ concreteCategory`
`+ elementsEquivalence`
`+ ext`
`+ fromCategoryOfElements`
`+ functor`
`+ homMk`
`+ hom_pt`
`+ id_obj`
`+ map`
`+ pullback`
`+ structuredArrowEquivalence`
`+ toCategoryOfElement`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I think this is the wrong definition, and there should be no mention of concreteness. If `C` has an initial object, then `Pointed C` should just be `Under (⊥_ C)`.

You may also want to relate this to `_root_.Pointed`, the category of pointed types. E.g. define a forgetful functor from `Pointed C` to `Pointed`, prove that the obvious square of functors commutes up to isomorphism, etc.

You may also want to relate this to `_root_.Pointed`, the category of pointed types. E.g. define a forgetful functor from `Pointed C` to `Pointed`, prove that the obvious square of functors commutes up to isomorphism, etc.

```suggestion
variable {D : Type*} [Category D] in

```
Alternatively, declare new universes `v' u'` and use `{D : Type u'} [Category.{v'} D]`.

```suggestion
/-- The pointed objects of a category `C`. A pointed object in `C` is an object `obj : C`
together with a distinguished element `pt` of the underlying type of `obj`, often called
the basepoint. -/
```

```suggestion
    (h₂ : (forget C).map (eqToHom h₁) A.pt = B.pt) :
    A = B := by
```

```suggestion
  cases A
  cases B
  cases h₁
  aesop
```

```suggestion
/-- The type of morphisms between pointed objects. A morphism of pointed objects is a morphism
in the original category between the objects which preserves the basepoints. -/
structure Hom (A B : Pointed C) where
  /-- the object morphism -/
  obj : A.obj ⟶ B.obj
  /-- compatibility with the basepoint -/
  pt : obj A.pt = B.pt := by aesop_cat
```

```suggestion
/-- Constructor for morphisms in the category pointed objects. -/
@[simps!]
```
AFAICT, these exact lemmas are generated by the `simps` attribute on the category instance, so they can be removed.

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem hom_pt {A B : Pointed C} (f : A ⟶ B) : f.obj A.pt = B.pt := f.pt
```
this isn't about the identity, but a general morphism

```suggestion
/-- The forward direction of the equivalence `Pointed C ≌ (forget C).Elements`. -/
@[simps obj]
def toCategoryOfElement :
    Pointed C ⥤ (forget C).Elements where
  obj X := ⟨X.obj, X.pt⟩
  map f := ⟨f.obj, f.pt⟩

/-- The reverse direction of the equivalence `Pointed C ≌ (forget C).Elements`. -/
@[simps map]
def fromCategoryOfElements :
    (forget C).Elements ⥤ Pointed C where
  obj X := ⟨X.1, X.2⟩
  map f := ⟨f.1, f.2⟩
```

I imagine it would be useful to define a "forgetful" functor `Pointed C ⥤ C` and prove that it is faithful. 
Then you can define the forgetful functor from `Pointed C` as the composition of that with the forgetful functor from `C`, and faithfulness will be inferred automatically.

pullRequest.title: feat: the category of pointed objects of a concrete category
